text.front:
Rosuvastatin
Rosuvastatin calcium
Jeremy Quirk, Mark Thornton and Peter Kirkpatrick
FRESH FROM THE PIPELINE
N E W S & A N A LY S I S
NATURE REVIEWS | DRUG DISCOVERY
VOLUME 2 | OCTOBER 2003 | 7 6 9
Rosuvastatin calcium (Crestor; AstraZeneca),
the seventh drug in the statin class, was
approved by the US FDA in August 2003 for
the reduction of cholesterol levels in patients
with hypercholesterolaemia. Billed as the
most potent statin available, can it overcome
initial setbacks and make a significant impact
in the multi-billion-dollar market for
cholesterol-lowering drugs?
Peter Kirkpatrick
is at
Nature Reviews Drug
Discovery.
JeremyQuirk and Mark Thornton
are
at
Decision Resources Intl,
50-51 Russell Square,
London, WC1B 4HQ, UK.
Correspondence to J. Q.
e-mail: jquirk@decisionresources.co.uk
doi:10.1038/nrd1205
